tweet_text: And today, alongside my colleagues, I cosponsored the introduction of National Day of Awareness for Missing & Murdered Native Women & Girls ‚Äì so we pause to remember the women and children that have been taken from us & commit to finding those who are still lost. (7/8)

name: Senator Ben Ray Luj√°n
tweet_text: In 2021, @SecDebHaaland rolled out a Missing and Murdered Unit that focuses on fact-gathering, publicizing and solving MMIP cases, and Congress took action by passing VAWA, Savanna's Act, the Not Invisible Act and my Native Youth and Tribal Officer Protection Act. (6/8)

name: Senator Ben Ray Luj√°n
tweet_text: There is very little research done on Native homicides, trafficking, and kidnapping. Let alone documentation. American Indian and Alaska Native people are at a disproportionate risk of experiencing violence, murder, or going missing. (5/8)

name: Senator Ben Ray Luj√°n
tweet_text:
More than 4 in 5 American Indian and Alaska Native women (84.3%) and men (79%) have experienced violence in their lifetimes. Yes ‚Äì you read that correctly ‚Äì more than 80% of Native people. 

These are epidemic numbers, but hardly ever talked about on the national level. (4/8)

name: Senator Ben Ray Luj√°n
tweet_text: Sometimes search parties work tirelessly for months, in some cases years, leaving families and Tribes without answers or their loved ones. These are not isolated incidences or random coincidences. (3/8)

name: Senator Ben Ray Luj√°n
tweet_text: For hundreds of years, Tribal and Indigenous people have been disappearing. Their families plead with local law enforcement to get involved or provide them updates on cases ‚Äì often left to self-organize search parties and hotlines. (2/8)

name: Senator Ben Ray Luj√°n
tweet_text: It‚Äôs been more than two years since the hurricane struck the island and caused billions of dollars in damage, left thousands without homes, and plunged Puerto Rico into chaos. Our friends and neighbors in Puerto Rico are counting on us to have their back.

name: Senator Ben Ray Luj√°n
tweet_text: The Trump administration is treating Puerto Ricans like second-class citizens ‚Äì and with a disregard that has obviously racial and bigoted undertones.

name: Senator Ben Ray Luj√°n
tweet_text:
What remains clear is that President Trump and his administration continue to hinder Puerto Rico‚Äôs recovery by illegally withholding disaster relief funding following the devastation caused by Hurricane Maria in 2017.

Their reasoning? There isn‚Äôt any.
